title: Understanding SQL ORDER BY Clause
text: The ORDER BY clause in SQL is used to sort the result set of a query by one or more columns. By default, it sorts in ascending order.

title: Sorting in Descending Order
text: To sort the results in descending order, you need to use the DESC keyword after the column name in the ORDER BY clause.

title: Selecting Specific Columns
text: When you want to display specific columns from a table, you list them after the SELECT keyword, separated by commas.

hintAnswer: SELECT FirstName, LastName FROM Student ORDER BY LastName DESC;
title: Constructing the SQL Query
text: Combine the knowledge of selecting columns and sorting to form the SQL query.
choices: SELECT FirstName, LastName FROM Student ORDER BY LastName DESC;
SELECT FirstName, ORDER BY LastName DESC;
SELECT FirstName, LastName FROM Student ORDER BY LastName;
SELECT FirstName, LastName FROM Student WHERE ORDER BY LastName DESC;
